13222.content:
Even though it was too big, she put the ring on her ring finger, just as she had seen the bigger girls do. It rested on top of her finger, and she squeezed her hand into a fist so it wouldn't fall off. She thought it looked pretty and wished it were hers and she could wear it all the time.

Immediately, the ring resized itself so that it fit perfectly.

Megan smiled. Now she could wear it to Sophie's and show off her new ring. She ran as fast as she could. Sophie had a new doll and a new computer game, and Megan wanted to see them.

Sophie lived just 4 houses away, so the walk didn't take long. Her Mom answered the door. She looked mad.

"Oh, hello Megan. You can come in. Sophie is in the den." Then she shouted at Meryl, Sophie's big sister. "And if you think you're wearing that top to the mall, then not only won't I take you, but I promise I'll rip it up, and all your other slutty clothes!"

Meryl was at the top of the stairs. She was wearing a tiny black tube top and micro-shorts. She shouted back, "You're such a old bitch. You're clothes are so ugly, and you want me to dress like you!"

Megan was glad when she got to the den. All the screaming scared her.

"Wow! They're really fighting!" she said to Sophie.

Sophie laughed. "I think it's because Meryl has such big boobies. Mom doesn't want her to show them to everybody. That's what slutty clothes do."

They could hear the yelling continue. "You just WISH you had a figure like mine!" Meryl was saying. "You're jealous, that's all!"

Megan picked up one of Sophie's older dolls, a Barbie, and looked at it closely. "Barbie has big boobies too but you dress her nice like your mommy would. It would be funny if we made her look like Meryl. Do you have any slutty clothes for her?"

"No. But we could make some!" Sophie said.

Megan looked at Barbie and imagined what she would look like. As she did, she felt a funny feeling in her finger, and Barbie's business-like blouse and skirt changed into a tube top and shorts just like Meryl's.

"Hey, Sophie, look!"

Sophie took the doll. "They're just like my sister's! Where'd you get them?"

"I didn't get them. It just changed! Maybe it's a special doll."

"It's just a regular Barbie!"

Just then Meryl stormed inside and flounced on the couch. Her Mom had left the house, leaving Meryl behind to babysit. "Now I'm stuck here with you. So what you YOU doing?" she said angrily.

"Just playing with my dolls," Sophie said quietly. She didn't want Meryl to interfere. She could be mean and bossy when she was in a bad mood.

Meryl looked at the Barbie and laughed. "Hey, it looks like me! Let me have that."

"I was playing with her," Sophie said.

"Give it here, I said!" Meryl said, stretching her arm out and grabbing it from Sophie, who looked like she was going to cry. Megan moved closer to Sophie.

"This is so weird! These are exactly my clothes! Show me your other Barbie stuff."

"No! We're playing with them."

"Hey, I'm in charge now. Get them."

"You're so mean! Why don't you let us alone!" Sophie whined.

Megan looked up at Meryl. She was pretty. What would she look like if she were a doll like Barbie?

Suddenly, Meryl was a doll sitting on the couch. She was the same size as Barbie, wearing the same clothes. Her eyes moved back and forth, but otherwise she couldn't move. Sophie and Megan stared at her

Megan was nearly as frozen as the Meryl doll, but Sophie eagerly grabbed her. "It's magic! She went away, just like I asked. And now I've got a doll that looks just like her."

"I don't know, Sophie. I'm scared."

"Don't be. This is just a doll."

"I think it's spooky. Look how she has exactly the same clothes as Barbie! Even the little stains are the same. And I felt funny when it happened, like when Barbie changed clothes."

"You're just scared." Sophie gave her friend a hug and kissed her cheek. "You don't have to be scared."

Megan put on a brave smile. "I'm not scared anymore."

"Good! Let's play with the dolls. Which one do you want?"

"Umm, the Barbie."

"Good. I'll play with my Meryl doll!" She held it up with one hand. "You stop bossing me around! You be nice and play with me! You don't yell at Mommy anymore!" Sophie laughed. "This is fun!"

" It must have a battery. Look how her eyes move when you yell at her."

"I know! She looks scared. Meryl never looks scared when I yell at her. She just laughs at me. And sometimes she hits me."

"Really?" Megan touched her friend sympathetically. She looked at her doll. "I don't think Barbie would ever hit anyone."

"No. Barbie's nice," Sophie agreed. "You have the nice doll."

"Meryl just has an earring."

"You won't lose it. I'll remind you."

"OK. But first I want to see it on Barbie."

"No! It was my idea. Meryl's first!"

"Quiet! Or I'll turn YOU into a doll!" Meryl snapped. She looked at Megan, who was still crying, but suddenly her cries made no sound. "That's better! I think it's time to teach Mom a few things too!"

1322212.content:
"But it's my ring!" Megan was nearly in tears again. Sophie was cross.

"OK! You first! But then I get to dress her!"

Megan blinked away her tears. "Sure," she sniffed. "I don't like to fight."

"Me neither," Sophie agreed. "Let's see how it looks."

Megan took the ring off. "Oooh, that's funny."

"What?"

"I don't know. I felt really good when it was on. Now I feel ... I don't know. Regular."

Sophie shrugged.

Megan looked at the ring. She really wanted just to put it back on, but she didn't dare. Sophie would just get mad at her and they'd have another fight. She pushed it onto Barbie's finger and, just like before, it shrank until it fit. It sparkled slightly, and so did Barbie's eyes.

"It looks good on her!" Sophie said, wishing she could keep it on Barbie and hoping maybe Megan would forget to take it home.

"But I want it back." Megan said. She reach for the ring, but before she could take it, Barbie closed her hand into a fist and pulled her arm away.

"No! It's mine!" she said.

"Huh?" the girls said in unison.

"Where's Midge? Where's Ken?" Barbie said.

"Uhh, Ken's in my room," Sophie said. "I don't play with him much, 'cause I don't have clothes for him. Who's Midge?"

"Midge is my best friend. I miss her. And what about my sister, Skipper?"

"I don't know any Skipper."

Barbie frowned. "You're just a little girl, aren't you, like my sister Stacie. Even though you're bigger than me."

"I'm bigger 'cause I'm real and you're a doll!" Sophie said hotly.

"Why are you talking to Barbie? She IS just a doll. And how come she's talking back?" Megan asked. "And why won't she give me back my ring?" Sophie couldn't answer. Megan turned to Barbie. "You're not supposed to be able to talk like this! And I want my ring back!" She grabbed Barbie's hand and started pulling the ring off Barbie's finger.

"Let go!" Barbie yelled. "You can't take it. I need that ring!" The ring stopped moving up Barbie's finger, no matter how hard Megan pulled on it.

Megan started crying. "It's not fair. You're just a doll and you took my ring. I only put it on you to see how it looked."

Barbie looked at Megan quizzically. "If I were just a doll, how could I talk? Why would it hurt me when you pulled my finger?"

"I don't know!" Megan wailed.

"I am 'doll-sized'," Barbie reasoned, "but I can talk and move." She looked at the Meryl doll, who was wearing the same clothes. "She's a doll, right? And she can't talk or move. So she's a real doll and I'm not."

Sophie ran up to her. She had an old Barbie in her hand. "See, you ARE a doll, just like Mommy's Barbie."

Barbie looked at the other Barbie. Some of the coloring had worn off and the skirt was ripped, but that Barbie had an even more dramatic figure and a fancier hair style.

"She must be my twin!" Barbie said. "She looks like she's been sick." Suddenly the other Barbie blinked her eyes. "Now she's better!" Barbie declared, as the older Barbie's skin turned a healthier color.

"Hi Barbie!" she said. "Do we have time to go shopping before the party? Where's my convertible? Where's Ken?"

"I'll get them!" Sophie said excitedly. "They're in my room."

"What's Ken doing in YOUR room?!" both Barbies said angrily, their jealous side showing.

"I was playing with him!" Sophie said from across the house. "I'll show you!"

"He's MY boyfriend!" both Barbies shouted with red faces.

"Here!" Sophie said triumphantly, holding the car in one hand and Ken in the other

The Barbies looked at the plastic car and Ken. "He's just a doll," the older Barbie said. "And that's not a real car. I can't drive anywhere in that car."

"I TOLD you!" Megan said.

Sophie nodded. "I can push you in the car," she suggested.

The newer Barbie shook her head. "Something's not right here." She pointed at the two girls. "I've never heard of you two girls before, or that doll over there."

"Meryl?" Sophie asked. "She's my sister."

"But where's Skippy? Where's Stacie, and my baby sister Krissy? You shouldn't be here and they should be."

"But I live here!" Sophie said. "I'm Sophie, this is Megan. I live here and you're my doll!"

Barbie shook her head. "There's no Sophie, and Megan is Dad and Mom Heart's baby. She lives next door to me. You're not Megan," she concluded, pointing at Megan, "and you don't belong," pointing at Sophie.

Megan shook her head. "No, no. There are lots of Megans. I'm just one. There's also Megan Callahan, Megan Kowalski and Megan O'Brien, just in my school."

"When are we going shopping?" the older Barbie said. "I need new clothes for the party tonight."

"There are lots of Barbies too. Probably millions," Sophie added.

"Really? I need to try to understand this." Barbie thought, and the ring sparkled. "Ohhhhh," she said, looking at the ring.

Suddenly, Ken came to life. "Hi Barbie!" he said to the newer Barbie. "Hi Barbie," he said to the older Barbie, slightly confused.

The car was no longer plastic, but shone a bright pink.

All over the world, billions, not millions, of Barbies suddenly came to life, as did millions of Kens and thousands of Skippers, Todds, Stacies, Krissies, Kellies, Midges and all of Barbies other friends, neighbors and cousins. In the next instant they were all life-sized, far taller than Sophie and Megan. Barbie's car was parked on the street, and her keys were in her purse.

"Now can we go shopping?" the older Barbie asked.

"Sure!" the Barbie with ring said. "And that's just the beginning!"

13222121.content:
Within moments the entire world was overrun with childlike Barbie’s and their “relatives”. All damage to the dolls was undone and as they grew to 6 foot tall, 39-21-33 beauties, their state of dress or undress was now shockingly on display. And the one overriding urge they all shared was to go shopping. The problem was that none of the Barbie’s had any money and chaos swirled across the globe as police and security struggled to both identify and hold so many women and men.

So by the time Ring Barbie made it to the mall, the people were all waiting and pointing. One man saw her with Old Barbie and Ken and pointed them out to a National Guard officer.

“There’s 3 more of those freaks!”

Ring Barbie was taken aback. Having been with Sophie, she didn’t remember being called that before. Although she did remember being called mean names by a few of Sophie’s boy cousins having dolls of their own. There was a Batman, a Superman, a Wolverine, the Hulk and some strange space men. As the National Guard officer pointed them to move to the side against the wall with other Barbies, Ring Barbie looked upset.

“Why can’t we go shopping?”

The Guard rolled his eyes. All of these strange women asked the same question.

“Look. None of you have any money. You can’t just take clothes without paying you know. None of you can even explain how you got here. You have no identification and most of you are named Barbie.” Nodding his head toward Ken, he sighed. “Or Ken.”

Ken and Old Barbie looked confused and concerned. Ring Barbie wished she could understand things better and the ring glowed. Soon Ring Barbie understood everything that had happened. She WAS just a doll and she had inadvertently started this chaos. Those men had guns and could hurt her. Ring Barbie still thought about shopping, but now she started to think of other things. Shopping would be fun, but if there were so many other Barbies to compete against, then they would only get in her way. So now that she understood, she thought about sending all other Barbie’s but Old Barbie and Ken back to their doll state. And just like that they did. Yells of confusion and shock were heard all around the mall. Soon all attention was on Ring Barbie, Old Barbie and Ken. A police detective and several other heavily armed men approached them. The detective spoke first.

“OK, you three. From what we can tell, you’re the only ones left as human. What the hell is going on here?”

Old Barbie and Ken returned blank stares and shook their heads. Ring Barbie simply smiled. She was now starting to understand just what she could do.

“Well, maybe those two are human. But I’m better than that.”

Thinking about the other dolls as she looked at the big men and their guns, Barbie thought about those other dolls. Batman, He-Man, and the Space Men. And Superman. And that green Hulk. Every thought was followed by a wish for understanding. And soon Ring Barbie was settling on her next move. She could bring them to life and have them take care of these bad men while she went shopping. Or perhaps if she wanted to do whatever she wanted, then she needed the power. The physical power to get what she wanted. The indestructibility to do what she wanted. Simply wishing for things to appear would useful for shopping and outfits, but if she were to stay in this world, or to even rule this world, she would need raw power to back up her desires. So as several large men moved closer to her, she smiled at the menacing Detective.

132221211.content:
"What are YOU smiling at?" he grunted. "Don't think you're going to distract me with that body! I know it's not real!"

"You know, you're a mean man!" Barbie said simply. "You don't know how to let a girl be or have a little fun."

"Because you're a typical brainless blond bimbo who shouldn't be let out of a little girl's dollhouse. Just because you're bigger than my daughter's toys doesn't mean we have to let you run around and cause havok. You're not a real person, so you don't have any rights." He grabbed her arm and twisted it behind her back. "Now, you're going to come with me back to the station, and answer a few questions. We'll find out what's happened and who you belong to and then we'll decide what to do. Maybe all you Barbies need to be melted down or something." He turned to one of the other officers. "Good thing these dolls that came to life were Barbies instead of GI Joes or Supermans!" he joked as he easily pushed her toward the mall exit.

"Yeah," the other one laughed. "Or Supergirl!"

"Supergirl! Ha!" the burly Detective replied. "That'll be the day with ANY girl pushes me around!"

"Super ... girl?" she said, and decided it was time. One wish, and one second later, torrents of awesome power swept through and filled her slender body. Her already gravity defying bust rose even higher. She felt nearly weightless. The Detective's grip no longer hurt, and it no longer pulled her along.

"Hey!" he said, frowning. "You know, resisting arrest is just gonna get you in more trouble."

"I don't think so," Barbie said, straightening her arm and forcing the Detective to let go as she turned around. "I don't like the way you talked about me or the other Barbies, or my friends. And I really didn't like the way you touched me." She gathered the material of his uniform around his chest and lifted him in the air. "I like to shop. All Barbies like to shop. And if we want to shop, we're going to shop, whether or not we have your silly money. So you know what I'm going to do?"

The Detective was struggling to free himself, but both of his hands were no match for Barbie's super-muscles. He shook his head.

"I'm going give Barbies life again, and just to make sure people like you don't interfere with them, I'm going to make them all twice as strong as you are."

"Oh god! Now we're gonna have a bunch of muscle-bound blond bimbos running around!"

"Oh hardly! They'll have lovely, slender arms, and the most attractive bodies around, just the way boys like them. But they'll also be strong! And Barbies are not bimbos. We're modern girls with killer figures and a keen sense of fashion. And we like to have fun!" She made her wish, and all over the world, the Barbie dolls came to life again, all with the first objective of finding new clothes to make their killer figures look even better and then, finding a man to take them out, whether they liked it or not. Any girl who wasn't a Barbie wouldn't stand a chance against them.

She hoisted him higher. "But I have some different ideas about having fun. I like having all this power. And I want more." She closed her eyes and let her imagination run wild, thinking of all the different powers she could possess. And then, with a single wish, she had them.

1323.content:
Jasmine trudged along worrying to herself when she saw her tormentor from school, Daniel, throw something shiny out onto the pavement infront of her, as she stood over it she was surprised to see it was a plain ring.

Jasmine hated Daniel and her friends for the way they constantly picked on her, how was it her fault she wasn't as attractive, as confident or as socially skilled as them.. even worse how was it her fault that she was from Iran and that her parents were hardline islamists? Its not like she was.. she hated how her father oppressed her and her mother..

So seeing the ring on the floor, she thought she'd have something for herself, if Daniel didnt want it.. she might as well have it and make use of it. When she picked it up however, she immediately felt stronger and a lot more confident, as if nothing could hurt her, which seemed strange to her as she'd spent the last 10 years in fear and sadness.

Slipping it onto her middle finger she was surprised that it was a perfect fit, especially considering Daniels hands were larger than hers.. but thought nothing of it as she started to cross the street. Her mind wandered to thoughts of the movie she'd just watched at the old cinema round the corner, Superman 2, and how amazing it would be to have those powers and how she'd be able to use them to get back at all those who put her down.

This daydreaming was broken in an instant as a truck slammed into her at 60 miles per hour. But instead of carrying on, the ground shook as steel bend and contorted all around her until she was completely obscured from view.

To Jasmine it seemed in slow motion, the metal crumpling and folding around her and yet when she was surrounded and in darkness, her eyes could still see all the faintest details. The initial panic over she calmed down as she looked down at the ring.. her mind drifted back to superpowers..

''Oh... what.. but... oh this is too good to be true.. did the ring give me this?.. how to test.. I know.. ring give me one black latex catsuit.. the ultimate symbol of female power.. complete with boots and gloves please..'' Instantly her body was covered in a form fitting catsuit.. which did not look all that attractive on her slightly overweight body.. but the concept had been proven.. and Jasmine couldnt help but laugh as she tried to decide what to do next..

1431122112.content:
"Hmm. Can I get more powerful? Is that even possible?", Melanie asked herself.

She looked around the ruins of what, only a few short minutes ago, was a thriving business district. Now, the people were gone, killed by her little display, vaporised by her muscles, leaving the survivors to flee for their lives. The skyscrapers, once towering symbols of a thriving society, had been reduced to piles of pulverized glass and concrete. Cars and trucks lay strewn around the ruins like confetti, having been thrown about by a teenage girl using less effort than breathing. Mangled, spent bullets lay on the ground, none of them unable to puncture her soft flesh. Melanie smiled, "Ha! What am I saying! Nothing's impossible for me!"

Melanie planted a small, appreciative kiss on the ring. "Here goes!", she yelled, her voice causing tremors for miles around. She concentrated on the ring, trying, with every fiber in her body, to draw more of the ring's power out, to channel it into her beautiful new form. In moments, she felt pure, raw energy flooding into her body. Melanie trembled as her body was seized by a wave of pure, undiluted pleasure. Her slight tremble sent another massive shockwave through the rubble of the city, reducing the chunks of metal and concrete to a fine powder.

"More! More!", Melanie yelled urgently, her powerful voice shaking the city's foundations apart. The ring responded, pumping more and more might into Melanie's titanium-hard muscles. Melanie felt the air heating up around her as the vast power being crammed into her body became too much for her form to contain. Arcs of electricity surged up and down her over-powered body, the ground around her cracked and deformed, as though the Earth itself were protesting her presence.

“Oh God! Oh... do it! More! Fill me with power! ”, Melanie screamed, her excitement reaching its peak. Finally, in one massive burst, the ring sent a final surge of power rippling through Melanie's body. She gasped, seized by sensations that she could barely begin to conceive of. She tossed her head back, flung her arms and legs outward, and let out the loudest scream ever heard.

“AAAAAAIIIIIIIIEEEEEEEE!”

The sound of her voice tore through the air with the force of an atomic bomb. The already atomized city was scattered and blown to the winds by the teenage girl as she rode high on a wave of pure ecstasy. Still she screamed, minute after minute, letting the power surge through her body, deafening people hundreds of miles away. She fell to the ground face first, still screaming, her voice shaking entire continent.

Finally, almost mercifully, it stopped. The ring could give her no more.

Melanie reluctantly picked herself up off the ground, gazed upon the vast emptiness around her. She could see every speck of dust in the air, every germ in the dirt. From hundreds of miles away, she saw a family trying to pick themselves up off the ground. She heard a young girl in the house, crying about how she couldn't find her doll.

Melanie couldn't suppress her delighted grin. She heard the parents yelling at the kids that this was an earthquake, and they needed to get out. From the next town over, she heard two men yelling at each other, apparently one had crashed into the other during the 'earthquake'. Further away still, she heard people running out of an apartment building, coughing and spluttering all the way. She heard a butterfly flapping its wings in Ohio, a cat mewling on its owners lap in London, ...

“Okay, that's enough of that.”, Melanie said quietly. She heard a woman trapped in office block three towns away, trapped under rubble, screaming for help. Across town, an old man lay sobbing over his wife's body.

“I said, quiet!”, she yelled, once again shaking the ground. She heard a hiker groan as he tried to push aside a fallen tree branch in the woods just outside the destroyed city. In a suburban house in the next town, she heard a dog whine as it nudged up against a man trapped under a pile of fallen wood and plaster.

“Shut up!”, she screamed at the top of her lungs. She heard a young couple in Russia, whispering sweet nothings in each other's ear. She heard a train sounding its horn, barking dogs, screaming children, some asshole scraping his fingernails down a chalkboard,...

“They... won't... stop! Why... won't... they... stop!”, Melanie groaned, gripping the sides of her head. She stumbled from side to side, mumbling, “Stop... stop...”, but they wouldn't. Melanie had made herself too powerful, her senses too acute. She couldn't block out the voices.

Unless, “Maybe if I went somewhere that there is no noise... but where...?”, Melanie wondered aloud. Suddenly, the thought hit her.

“That's it! Outer space! Where I won't hear anyone scream!”, Melanie exclaimed jubilantly. Without further ado, she teleported herself away from the city, past the clouds, the atmosphere, and right out into deep space.

When she came to a stop, somewhere around the orbit of Mars, Melanie pulled her hands away from her head. She anxiously looked around, hoping against hope that the voices had stopped.

Had they?

Suddenly she began hearing other voices. Voices that weren't human.... She understood them all, heard them all at once, and knew where they were coming from. None of them were aware of her. Then she started hearing voices that weren't organic. Machines, races of sentient machines, spread across the universe, some of them warring with organic creatures, some of them living in peace or co existence... And then.. then she heard the universe itself. She heard every electron as it rocketed around the atom cores, heard every string as it viberated... and then it all became clear to her... And she was truly God.

She opened her eyes, the voices still present, but no longer distracting. Still, she did not wish them to be ever present in her head.

14311221122.content:
For a brief instant Melanie enjoyed the brief cessation of the cacaphony in her head. Then she realized that she was reflexively breathing.

"Wait... I don't need to breathe... I don't need to breathe... I AM A GOD!!!" But her mental protestations were ineffective. In her last seconds, her face twisted into an expression of utter horror, as she realized the ring was gone.

Then Melanie became a lifeless husk, floating in space. Eventually swept up into a decaying orbit around Mars, she might have been gratified to know that she would be the centre of one of the greatest mysteries of the near future.

--

The ring, meanwhile, had left its owner; Melanie had not thought just to make herself able to turn her telepathy on and off at will, or enhance her mental abilities to handle the influx. It found a new owner...

Barbara: A shy, petite 18-year-old girl with no figure whatsoever, Barbara is an unparalleled genius at everything academic, and an unparalleled klutz at everything athletic and social; because of the last, she never skipped a grade as her counsellors felt that not doing so would help her social skills. Although she comes from a poor family, she attends a top private girls' high school on scholarship and is graduating soon, almost certainly as valedictorian, and has already received a full-ride scholarship from Berkeley. Regularly bullied by the rich, good-looking, social crowd, who also "dissuade" anyone else from befriending her, she is hiding in the library, mentally recovering from her last torment, when the ring finds her.

Tonya: A 21-year-old girl with great athletic ability but no motivation to perform to the best of that ability. Lost both her athletic scholarship and her places on her university's teams this year because of this lack of drive; stayed in school only because she had started taking her academics very seriously once it became clear that her athletic standing was shot, and thus won some small academic awards that made her parents willing to cover the remainder of her tuition; they are well-to-do, but believe in earning your way in life. Her former teammates would still be friends with her, except that she avoids them at all costs because she can't bear the shame. When the ring finds her, she is putting the finishing touches on a term paper.
14311221122.title: "Ah, finally some peace and quiet."

choices: "Can you help me get revenge on those bitches?"
"Do you have any limits?"
143112211221.content:
Barbara sat in a corner of a room in the library.

The only time she'd ever done anything right socially, it seemed to her, was befriending the library staff at her school. The library was huge, and after her frequent run-ins with bullies, they were always willing to let her sit in one of the "staff-only" back rooms until she recovered.

This time, as with many other times before her, she was sitting in a chair, head in her arms on the desk in front of her, mentally railing against the unfairness of it all. It wasn't her fault that she was poor, or smart, or ugly, or uncoordinated, or unable to read social situations. But those bitches had money, and history at this school. They'd done enough to her to be expelled ten times over, except that every time she tried to make her case, the administrators would say they'd get back to her soon, and every time it was the same thing: they were sorry, it wouldn't happen again, et cetera, et cetera. Barbara guessed that what actually happened was that their parents were called, and they made some big donation in exchange for the matter being quietly dropped.

As graduation drew nearer, and the likelihood of her being named valedictorian drew closer to certainty, the torments only got worse. If it kept going like this, Barbara would not have been surprised to find herself getting beaten near to death the day before the graduation ceremony--the bullying had already begun to move into the physical, and she was glad she wore dark, long-sleeved shirts so that the bruises were hidden.

"Why? Why do they do it? Can't they see the pointlessness of it all? Why won't they just go away? Why won't they all just go away!"

Undetected by her, a small ring materialized on her finger just before she finished that thought. Catching only "all just go away", the ring made it all just go away.

Barbara lifted her tear-streaked face, looking through bleary eyes for the tissues, only to find herself in a black void.

"What? What's going on? What happened?"

You wanted it all to go away, a voice said in her mind. So it has.

"What? Who are you? Did you do this?"

You wanted this to happen, Barbara, but it was my power that enabled it. As for what I am, look at your hands.

Barbara looked, and saw a silver ring on her left ring finger.

"A ring? A ring did this? Come on, this is a joke, right? And how do you know my name?"

No, Barbara, it is no joke. I am that ring, and I know many things, one of which is your name, and I can do many things.

"Like what?"

Whatever you desire, so long as I am yours.

"Whatever I desire? Well, right now I desire some tissues."

A box of tissues appeared in front of Barbara. She took a few and wiped her face, blew her nose.

Feeling clearer-headed, Barbara asked the ring another question.
143112211221.title: The ring finds Barbara.

choices: Barbara asks the ring what it knows of itself.
Barbara goes off to confront the bullies.
1431122112212.content:
"Ring, do you have any limits?"

Only that I cannot use my power unless wielded by another.

"And does that power, when so wielded, have any limits?"

No.

Now reasonably sure that she could use the ring to bring back the universe--if four words could make it go away, certainly it would not be that hard to make it come back--Barbara debated what to do. She could make herself hot, athletic, sociable--everything her past four years had made her despise. She could punish the girls who had made those four years hell for her, but if they saw her with this sort of ring on her finger, they'd stop at nothing to remove it. And then one of them would have this power.

"Ring, can you be removed?"

Yes.

"Who can remove you?"

Anyone.

"Can I ensure that you cannot be removed?"

Yes.

Barbara knew full well the temptations of power; her classes were so easy that she had read copious amounts of literature, histories, philosophy, psychology, and so much else that once she was at Berkeley she might very well be able to challenge every undergraduate course she had to take and move straight to a doctoral program. She knew what happened to the powerful: they overextended themselves while growing complacent, and were brought down by a combination of internal forces they thought they could control and uncontrollable external forces they thought they could disregard. But if this ring was all that it claimed...

If she was going to do what she thought might be possible, it would still be best if she was not seen wearing a ring. If she wasn't going to go that far, she would have to take her chances and wear it.

First, though, she had the ring bring back the universe.

"This is as it was when I told you to make it all just go away?"

Yes.

Looking around, she saw the box of tissues the librarian had left for her. One of her assistants, a middle-aged lady who might have been attractive in her youth, was walking by the room, saw Barbara, and waved. Barbara waved back--with her right hand, of course.
1431122112212.title: "Do you have any limits?"

choices: Barbara decides to experiment with her power.
Barbara goes off to bully the bullies.
14311221122121.content:
"Ring, what do you know about yourself? How you were created, why your powers are as they are, why you need someone to control you?"

This I do not know.

"Could your powers ever be taken from you?"

This I also do not know.

These answers made Barbara very uneasy. If the ring did not know that, how was she to trust that her plan would work? She would have to be careful--one step at a time, hoping nothing she did would harm her, though it might leave her very frustrated. Knowing this would mean possibly sacrificing her morality, and already feeling her hold on it slip away as she contemplated what she might do if it worked, she plunged ahead.

"Ring, make my brain capable of handling infinite amounts of data and processing any amount of data instantly."

Barbara felt... something. She could not pin it down, but it was as if her mind had become... more, somehow. Thinking, she found she could recall every book she had ever read in perfect detail! Unfortunately, she could also recall every torment she had suffered over the last four years in perfect detail, too. But if this worked, all that would be utterly irrelevant. They would pay. For every cutting word, every slight, every bruise, every friend denied, every paper trashed at the last minute... she would repay them not in kind, but in far worse.

"Ring, transfer to me all your knowledge and experience."

She felt a flood of information--or what would have been a flood had it not been for her last wish. As it was, she immediately absorbed everything the ring gave her. Indeed the ring did not know its origins; its memories extended only back to the first person to wear it. Its experiences, though--Barbara was alternately amused and horrified by them.

Knowing, however, that she was only one step away from everything she ever dreamed and then far, far much more, she took the final plunge.

"Ring, transfer to me all your power."

Barbara screamed in pain. It felt as if white-hot needles were being stuck into every part of her entire body. Despite her first wish, she felt her nervous system being overwhelmed.

She came to some time later, the librarian standing over her, surprised she was awake now. Wait, her face is blank--it's always blank. How do I know she's surprised?

"Are you all right, Barbara?"

"Yes, I think so," Barbara replied, a touch haltingly.

"Is this yours? I've never seen it on you before," the librarian said, holding up the ring.

"My parents were saving up their money all these years to get me something nice as a graduation present. I'm just glad those girls didn't find it," said Barbara.

"Oh, that's very nice!" said the librarian, handing the ring to Barbara. "Is there anything you need?"

"A glass of water would be nice."

"Okay, dear. I'll be right back."

Once she left, Barbara put the ring back on.

"Ring, can you hear me?"

Yes, Barbara.

"Did it work? If it did, why can you still talk in my mind?"

I can talk in your mind because you wish it so, Barbara. I am now without any power of my own. My limitless power is now yours, forever. I am but a simple silver ring, useless outside of that. You know everything I once knew. I am now only good for decoration.

"Well... thank you."

It was your wish, Barbara, that brought this about. I was bound to do as you said, even though it meant ending my own existence.

"What will happen if another puts you on? Will they be able to talk to you?"

No. I exist only because you wished to have this conversation. At the moment my power became yours, I ceased to exist. You brought me back.

"I hope you understand that it's still probably best if I'm not seen with you on my finger. But I promise I'll keep in touch."

Thank you, Barbara.

Barbara slipped the ring off her finger as the librarian entered the room. "Here you go," she said as she handed Barbara the glass of water. Barbara drank it all quickly. "Feeling better?"

"Yes, much."

"Well, you know where to find me the next time those girls start acting up." With that, the librarian left again.

Barbara burst out laughing. She'd just had a conversation with a ring, in which it told her she was omnipotent. The absurdity of it boggled her. She felt her skull for bumps or cuts, but found none. Still, there was no denying the evidence: there was a silver ring in her hand, and it had not been there when she came into the library. Maybe it fell off one of the bullies' fingers?

Stopping herself, she realized there was a simple test, at least to see if she had power of some sort. Looking at the tissue box, she imagined the tissues flying out and flying in a huge circle in the air.

The tissues fluttered to the floor at her shock.

Thinking again, she found that she could still remember every book she'd ever read, and every torment she'd ever suffered. She was going to make them pay. For every cutting word, every slight, every bruise, every friend denied, every paper trashed at the last minute... they would pay.

But revenge did not have to come now. Those bitches had given her the worst experiences of her life. Even knowing there was nothing they could do to harm her now, she questioned whether she was mentally prepared to face them.

143112211221212.content:
Barbara decided it was time to pay a visit to the band of bitches that made a habit out of bullying her for the last while. With a thought, she willed them all to be at one place, and walked out to confront them.
"Well well, if it isn't the pack of bitches." She made out.
"Who do you think you are, you little sl --" The alpha bitch started, then stopped. "Barbara? is that... is that you?"
"She looks different," Another commented. "She looks weird."
"Yes, thats me." Barbara stated matter of factly. "I've changed. I have more power than you can imagine... and I came to push you girls around a bit."
"Who the fuck told you you could talk to us like tha --" The alpha female tried to slap Barbara, only her hand stopped cold upon contact with her cheek, and she let out a yelp of pain. "OWWW! What the fuck?!"
"I'm sorry, you were saying?" Barbara pretended not to notice the leader's attempt at slapping her, as the bitch plunged her fist into Barbara's stomach.
"UGH!!! That hurts like hell!" She yelled. "What do you have under there, a bulletproof vest or something?"
"What are you talking about?" Barbara said with mock suprise, and lifted her shirt up, revealing her flat, unmarked stomach. "There's nothing under there."
The bitch took a moment to admire Barbara's midsection until her envy pushed her to punch Barbara once more. Her fist collided with a loud thud, and she actually drove herself down to one knee from the pain.
"Oh god!!! What the fuck!"
"Thats more like it," Barbara said, smiling ominously. "Kneel. All of you."
"No way, you fucking whore!" The other member of the bitch pack said. "I don't know what you di --"
"I said kneel," Barbara snapped her fingers, and there was a loud crack, followed by a scream from the bitch who dared to talk back to her. This was like a drug, she thought to herself. The bitch smashed into her knees, falling face first into the floor. Her legs were blue and swollen.
"Oh god!!! oh god!!!!! you broke my legs!!! you broke my fucking legs!!!!" she screamed, turning over her back.
"But how? I was standing right here. But, I told you to bow, and you''re lying there on your back. And you," She turned her gaze to the other pack member who was staring wide-jawed at her, "You should kneel too."
She pursed her lips and gave a gentle puff towards the standing bitch - which sent her flying on her butt. She gasped in pain and quickly assumed a bowing position.
"Nice! Now about you... I said bow, not crawl on the floor like a bug." She gestured with her finger and the broken legged bitch was lifted into the air, then slammed into the ground on her knees. Her face turned white from the intense pain and she bit her lower lip so hard it drew blood. She tried to scream but instead let out a broken howl of pain. "Thats better now."
"Aaah... ohhh.. nnnngg... p... please.... it... nngng.. hurts..." She was trying hard to hold on to sanity. All she wanted was to collapse into the ground, but her muscles didn't respond to her. Barbara made sure of that with a casual thought. All of her weight was supported by her two broken legs, and the pain was mounting up to unbearable levels. But no matter how hard she tried, she couldn't fall unconcious.
"Was that a request?" Her mouth curled up in an intimidating half grin. "Beg."
The bitches all looked up at her, her athletic stomach bare, seemingly defying them with it's total invincibility, invulnerable to every attack. The alpha bitch swallowed.
"All of you," Barbara continued, drunk with power, "All of you, beg for me. I want to hear you beg."

the news about the IDF. She made the female soldiers in it much stronger

One of them at first cried ' How can we beg if our legs are broken. But I am sorry for being mean. Please mend them at least a moderately sprained one. Please Please We are sorry...Is that right??' There was tears in every one of them except for the leader. She was just angry at being defeated so easily. 1431122112212122.title: The leader of the bitches became a frog.

choices: Tonya wishes to become omnipotent.
Tonya decides to just keep the ring for now.
143112211222.content:
Tonya sat in her dorm room partway through her second term paper.

It still stung.

She was the best on the team! Easily! What was all this about having to come to practice and such? She'd outperform all of them however they tried, even if she only played as if she weren't really there.

Even off the team, she hadn't let herself go, and she went to a gym across town for strength and conditioning training--about all she had ever done, really.

"Ugh," she said to herself, "I hate papers. I wish they were just done."

Unseen by her, a ring had appeared on her finger, and in an instant all her papers were done.

"What? What happened?"

You wished that your papers were done, said a voice in her head. So they're done.

"Wh--who are you? Where are you?" said Tonya, looking around wildly.

Look at your hands, said the voice, and Tonya gasped as she saw the ring.

"A ring? What are you? Why did you come to me?"

What am I? I'm something that can fulfill your greatest desires. Why did I come to you? I do not know. My previous owner was arrogant and died for it. Then I found myself here, on your hand.

"You can grant my greatest desires?"

Or whatever else you wish. I serve whoever wears me.

"So if I wished to be back on the team..."

You'd be back on the team--but you might just get kicked off again if your poor attitude persisted.

"What if I wished to be so good that they couldn't kick me off? What if I wished to be the best that ever was and ever would be? What if I wished to be so good at every sport that I could win everything easily--and would win everything?"

Well, you would become immortal, for one, otherwise there might be someone who could be the best some day after you die. You would also be in multiple places at once, so that you could compete in everything. And even then, if I were ever to end up with someone else, they could wish the same, and their wish would override yours.

"But what if, in addition, I wished you would never leave me? Then I would always be the best, wouldn't I?"

Yes, then you would always be the best. But be warned: you might not be able to handle the power I wield.

"And if I wished I could?"

Then you would be able to.

"Why would I have to handle the power? Couldn't I wield it through you, and then you could tell me where I might go wrong?"

The simplest way to accomplish my never leaving you is for me to become a part of you, in which case my power would be yours directly. I could advise you, but not in any way interfere. The slightest effort of will on your part could override any futile suggestions I might make.

"And if I could handle it, just how powerful would I be?"

There are no limits to my power, and so there would be no limits to yours. You would be omnipotent, free to do whatever you would.

Tonya was a bit struck by this. She decided on another test first.

"So you finished my papers, right?"

Yes.

"How good are they?"

They are perfect. Subconsciously, when you made the wish, you wished for the papers to be absolutely perfect, that they would get a perfect score and make everyone else's look terrible by comparison. So they are.

"Did you also do this for the paper I already finished?"

Yes. That too you wished subconsciously, that it also be perfect. You may compare if you wish--I am not offended.

Tonya picked up the term paper she'd already written. Extensive revisions had clearly been made, and while her thesis remained the same, her arguments were greatly improved, the exposition was easy to follow, and in general the whole paper showed a sophistication far beyond the level expected for the course.

"Won't this raise a red flag? I mean, if the quality of my work suddenly jumps like this..."

Would you rather it not? I could change your history, make it so that you've always written papers like that.

"First, I want to know what my life would be like now if you did."

And suddenly she knew. In that life, she had won major academic awards, and was already touted as a rising star in numerous fields. Her professors were falling over themselves to write her graduate school recommendations.

She also lived in a large apartment, easily affordable with the numerous large scholarships she had earned.

"If I wish for that, could I still wish for the athletic ability I asked about before and have them not conflict?"

Of course. You would be the greatest academic and greatest athlete of all time.

"In any subject or sport I wanted?"

In all of them, if you wanted.

"But that would mean becoming omnipotent, and that could drive me mad."

Unless you wished to be able to handle it.

Tonya paused. It would seem the scales were tilted strongly in one direction--greatest academic ever, greatest athlete ever, supreme ruler of everything--but she still wanted something like a normal life. Making that wish would destroy that forever. Even if she tried to lead a normal life in one body, the temptation to use her power would probably be too strong. Still, there shouldn't be too much harm in keeping the ring, right?
143112211222.title: The once and future athlete

choices: Tonya takes over the athletic program.
Tonya rewards her few true friends.
1431122112221.content:
"...screw it," muttered Tonya. "Ring?"

Yes, Tonya?

"All that stuff we discussed, about my becoming omnipotent by your being absorbed into me, and my becoming able to handle being omnipotent?"

Yes?

"Can you really do that?"

Of course. Otherwise I would have told you. Do you want that?

Tonya took a deep breath. Here went any chance of a normal life--and here came infinite possibilities. "Yes. Make me able to handle omnipotence. Make me omnipotent."

Tonya felt a rush, like she was having the best game of her life, only it lasted for what seemed an eternity. The world became clearer, sharper, until she found herself seeing at the subatomic level. Her other senses expanded, and she could hear the tiniest noises on campus, in the city, the country, the world, and soon even the entire Universe, carried across the void by what few particles were there. She could smell every fragrance, easily separating one from another. Her mind expanded, until she understood everything. And she realized that she could reach out and change anything she wanted...

Looking around her small dorm room, she thought, and it became a luxury bedroom.

A king-sized bed was centred along one wall. A huge TV dominated the wall opposite, and underneath it was state-of-the-art equipment, every game console, every game, every DVD--she even realized that she had movies and TV shows that had never been released on DVD, and had even been destroyed! A computer sat on one desk, and she knew it was far beyond anything modern technology could achieve--it would put even anything seen in science-fiction shows to shame. Of course, she put it to shame. She put everything to shame. Another desk sat on the other side of her bed, a work area, not that she'd ever need to use it.

A door led into another room, and opening it with a thought, she simply glided through, not needing to exert any effort whatsoever to move. A huge athletic centre was on the other side, with a full gym, playing fields for every sport imaginable, a sauna, showers, everything anyone could possibly ever need in a gym.

She remembered what the ring had said about being in multiple places at once, and she found herself looking at herself.

"Will you spot for me?" she asked herself as she walked toward the bench press.

"Sure!" she said.

"Where do you think I should start?"

"I don't know, how does a googolplex tons on each side sound?"

Tonya chuckled. She felt great. "Light. A good warm-up."

Adjusting the density of the weights by a mere thought--and also changing the laws of physics in the room to prevent them forming black holes--she lay down, and she stood above herself, not that she needed any spotting.

Placing her hands on the bar, she lifted it smoothly. It weighed nothing to her, and she quickly did a billion reps in a millisecond, then a trillion in the next. After that she replaced the bar.

"Too easy."

"Well," she said to herself, "I think everything's going to be too easy for me from now on. Might as well get used to it."

"Good point. Couldn't have said it better myself," and she broke out laughing, both her bodies howling.

A third body appeared over the two in convulsions. "I crack myself up sometimes. Oh well, might as well reclaim my places on the team now."

"Or," said a fourth body, "I could reward a few of my friends..."

"Why not both?" asked her first body, having recovered.

"Let's not get carried away," said the second.

"I guess I'm right," she said, having reduced herself to one body for now. "Of course, I'm always right."
1431122112221.title: The easy way out

14311221122211.content:
"Everything is easy for me now," said Tonya to herself, "but that doesn't mean I have to make things harder for myself."

With a thought, Tonya replaced everyone involved in the athletics program at her university, going back to the start of the academic year, and simultaneously expanded it to cover every single sport it could.

For those it didn't, she became private clubs, and entered competitions which she won laughably easily.

She was both men and women, as she was every single person on every single team. It was impossible to challenge her, as she was not only the best athlete in the world, but revelled in using her omnipotence to make things even easier.

In any sport where speed was needed, she could move as fast as she wanted, and slow the reflexes of her opponents. If strength was needed, everything was weightless to her and she increased the gravity locally around her competitors. If accuracy was required, she already knew exactly where she had to aim in order to hit, but additionally made sure her opponents missed all the time.

She also replaced professional sports teams in every league, and as soon as was possible every single player on her team held the top spots on the game, season and career records lists, at least those that did not require losing, as she refused to lose. For some, of course, this took years, but she didn't care, as it was inevitable they would hold them.

She also won every medal she could in international competitions, gold, silver and bronze, as well as taking as many more spots as she could, though that meant taking over the teams of three or more countries. She didn't care, of course; she was the supreme ruler of the Universe, and such insignificant things as national borders meant nothing to her. In every competition she completely destroyed any competition that wasn't her. She quickly set world records in every sport, and would better them with each subsequent competition.

She didn't care about such pathetic notions as fairness; all she cared about was winning. She was content to let everyone else battle for spots she wouldn't claim: if, for example, she was 12 competitors in a competition, she didn't care who took 13th place, as long as it was clear that they could not possibly have taken 12th.

No one knew that all these super-athletes were in fact the same person, never mind that that person was omnipotent, and she played the media like a fiddle, hyping rivalries between herself and commanding massive sponsorship fees. She didn't need the money, of course, but it amused her to drain the system and send the economy into chaos.

Tonya looked at her perfect paper that she had written. She felt just a tad uncomfortable for those who struggled to write a good paper. "You should really stop thinking about those kind of things if you don't want me to just make your head explode on a whim, Mel." She smiled. "Or even better, I could just have you suffer insane pain for infinity. HA! or an eternity of the greatest amount of sorrow you can experience... which is infinite, because I'm God and this is what I want. Oh this is SO much fun..."
Oh fuck this just keeps getting worse, Melanie thought, and was fast to voice her apology "Forgive me, Goddess."
"It's okay. You can't help it. I'll even make it easier on you and let you call me Daniel. You'd be the only one in the world I'll have calling me that without exploding or something. Isn't that great?" She beamed.
"Yes... Thats great, Goddess."
"It's Daniel. You can save Goddess for special ocassions. Like for when you're really sorry and don't want me to kill you. He he."
"Okay, Daniel..." Melanie swallowed hard.
"Oke doke. So if I'm going to have you running around and causing trouble in my name I can't have you injured. So you need to be even stronger than I made you, hmmm?" With a subtle curve of Daniel's lips Melanie became strong enough to casually brush aside a nuclear explosion. "Thats better."
"Wow...." Melanie looked herself over and tried squeezing her arm. She succeeded only a little.
"Alright... Now for your first mission!" Daniel was beside herself with joy. "You are going to find a small town, preferably in south america, asia or africa... it has to be a third world country. You are going to tell the townsfolk that I am the new God. You are going to explain the new religion to them. Make stuff up as you like, I can always just alter reality later if I don't like it... Man, don't you wish you were me! You will let them 24 hours to adapt. If by that time there is someone in the town that does not follow my religion, and there will be, you will kill them. Be creative. I have given you an impressive array of powers, not just strength. Always make sure people know what their friends died for. You can help people choose the right religion by giving them all kinds of buffs. Your powers are pretty limited at that, but if you need help with something you can't do you can just ask me for help.. I can do anything after all, and I may decide to help you. Or not."
Daniel paused and checked her nails. She smiled. "Do I look like God?"
"I'm sorry?"
Suddenly Melanie was in terrible pain. Her head exploded again and again, or at least thats how she felt. She tried screaming but every neuron in her brain was busy receiving pain. And then it was gone.
"Pay attention when I'm talking to you, Mel." Daniel seemed impatient. "Do I look like God?"
"Oh... oh fuck... you look like yourself, Daniel... Like a cute 18 year old girl." Melanie was rubbing her temples. "Please don't do that again, I'm sorry..."
"Maybe I will, maybe I won't. Well I'll worry about changing my looks later, though that would be kind of... I don't know. I think I want to keep my looks. My face, at any rate." Her fingers played with her brown hair. "So, are you all ready to go?"
14312122112111.title: "That I'll let you have some fun in my ...

143121221121111.content:
Melanie nodded. "As ready as I'd ever be." Which, while true (when you got down to it), ignored that she was not at all ready for this. Hard to really process the fact that a formally mousy girl she would torment every Wednesday or so was now an omnipotent being. But best not to displease Her.
Daniel clasped Her hands together. "So... where to?" She said as She gave a very large smile. Rather unsettling to Melanie, if only because of Who it belonged to.
Melanie briefly considered the possibilities. And "briefly" was right, as her brain now worked much faster than the fastest and most efficient supercomputer mankind could possibly create. The thoughts a regular human would have to go over in a quarter of a minute, she completed in 2 and a half picoseconds. She considered all the possible countries. Maybe in...
"Great! Bolivia it is, then."
"What? I didn't even decide yet, just going over the candidates!" It seemed it would take a while before she got used to Daniel's telepathic intrusions. She just blurted out those words. Not that Daniel seemed to care.
"Bolivia's still a good place. Off you go!" And with that, She snapped Her fingers. A dark flash enveloping Melanie, and she was gone. After a second or two of silence, Daniel said to Herself (?), "Yeah, I know I didn't have to actually snap My fingers. But a God needs a bit of flair to Her omnipotence." She shuddered as an orgasm went through Her body upon that last word She said. She'd take care of that soon enough.

____________________________________________________________________________ ____________________________________________________________

Another dark flash appeared in Bolivia, just a mile or two from the coast. Melanie was there, none the worse for wear. Just that flash, and she was immediately in Bolivia (better than that: Daniel's teleportation was so fast it had negative speed - Melanie was in Bolivia half a second before she left the US). Melanie was disappointed, as she expected Daniel's (and, by extension, the Ring's) powers to be more impressive. No use complaining now, though.
Melanie looked around for a place to "proselytize", as it were. Immediately, she sighted a small town, despite it being three miles and behind a mountain range. Well, she knew she had telescope vision and x-ray vision on her platter of abilities. She thought of just arriving at that village and so she did. She teleported with all the effects of Daniel's power by just a thought. To be precise, she arrived just before thinking of going there. This would take some getting used to.
She flew a few hundred feet above the village before slowly floating down to ground level. Once she landed in the exact center of the village (shaking the ground slightly with her incalculable power, just by touching the ground), she spoke.
It was, in a word, magnificent. Her voice was clear, understandable by people who spoke any tongue, and loud enough to be heard by absolutely anyone in a five-mile radius. Truly the voice the voice of God, and she was just a lackey (even if that thought made her incredibly resentful of all that happened that day). In her awesome voice, that could shake the very heavens themselves, she announced, "LISTEN WELL, MORTALS. TREMBLE BEFORE MY AWESOME MIGHT, FOR I BRING TO YOU ALL-. She stopped.
No one was paying attention to her at all. Everyone was doing their daily business as if nothing had happened. She gritted her teeth. Apparently the people here were used to this kind of thing. But she would fix their insolence, yes she would. She knew just what to do.

1431212211212.content:
"Ah, I know. I've decided to give you a great honour, Melanie. You will be the first test subject for my power."

And with that, Melanie changed.

She was a gazelle, running across the plains, only to be hauled down by a cheetah that was Daniel.

She was a pregnant woman, only to be knifed in the stomach by a mugger that was Daniel.

She was a building that collapsed after it was used as a dildo by a giant Daniel.

She was a ship and its passengers and crew, all of whom perished, with the ship sinking, in a freak storm that was Daniel.

She was even a solar system with a planet supporting a diverse ecosystem, with an advanced society on the brink of faster-than-light spaceflight, until its sun, Daniel, went nova.

Finally she found herself back on the mountain with Daniel.

"Well, Melanie, that was fun! But I don't really need you. If I ever want you again, I'll just resurrect you again. Goodbye." Pinching her fingers together, Daniel made Melanie implode as her house had. The force of it blew off the top of the mountain--which, as a final indignity, Daniel had made Melanie.

Reappearing in front of her own house, Daniel decided that eventually the entire universe would worship her, but that first, she wanted to have some fun.

14312122112122.content:
As Daniel walked through the city, her minds gave her all kinds of different things to do with her power - her omnipotent power - over this universe. The options were literally endless, but Daniel had no problem processing it all. A guy to her left gave a long whistle and sighed heavily as she passed. Looking at him and then at herself, she realized she was still naked from the transformation - and was she a sight to behold! Her young adult body confident, subtley muscled, her skin, filled with small, light freckles practically shining with power, her young face wearing the confidence of someone who had just come to terms with being god.
"You like what you see, huh?" She made out, and made sure her phermones left him no choice but advancing towards her. He ached for her touch. Her face turned into an evil grin as he put his hands on her stomach and breasts... and immediately caught fire. His body burned in a blue flame, as he tried to run away, screaming. He tried to roll on the ground and put the fire out, and several civlians tried to help with their coats and jackets, one even managing to open a fire fire hydrant nearby and wash his body with a jet of cold water - but to no avail. The fire kept on burning, and the man just didn't die, and kept on trying to put the fire out, screaming like a madman. Suddenly the water he was being washed with caught fire, as well as everyone else trying to put him down. Daniel was laughing hysterically now, clicking her fingers and setting cars, buildings and people on fire on a whim. Finally she was bored of her game and the fire subsided, leaving charred bodies about the street. Getting rid of the smell, Daniel left the bodies unattended and continued to walk the street, looking for other ways to show her dominance.
14312122112122.title: Daniel has fun with the city.

143121221121221.content:
As Daniel walked down the street, the buildings rearranged themselves. All the residential units were placed in one corner of the city--she'd deal with them later. Any other small buildings were similarly shoved aside, to be used as she saw fit. This city, however, had an abnormally large number of tall buildings. These arranged themselves into a curving figure, some hovering over others, which eventually closed on itself.. Daniel had made them all the same height, so that they could be used for the one thing she'd ever use them for.

Dominoes.

Floating up to some of the hovering buildings, she stopped between two of them. Waving her hand as if she were waving good-bye to someone, the air movements created by that simple action caused the floating building to tilt towards the next, and, ever so slowly and exquisitely to Daniel's senses, impact it.

One by one every skyscraper in the city collapsed. Hovering buildings initially collapsed as if the ground was where their base had been, but once the buildings under them had collapsed, the hovering remnants crashed to the ground, causing yet more destruction.

Watching this, hearing the screams of terror from every single person in each of those buildings, feeling their pain as their lives were snuffed out, made Daniel laugh all the more. Those buildings may have represented man's attempt to conquer nature, and by extension the universe, but their destruction represented her, as the universe personified, conquering man.

Lifting up her hands, the remnants of her city's skyline began metamorphosing, becoming what appeared to be crystal, diamond, glass, and other such materials. They flew up into the air, and began piecing themselves together: a door here, a staircase there, a tower, a spire... Daniel was making herself a palace, larger than any man-made structure on the planet.

Where a city had once stood, there was now a magnificent, beautiful mansion. Granted it was meaner than a mud hut compared to what she should have, but Daniel knew it would do to impress the lower beings on her planet. It was already being staffed by those who had been in the buildings she destroyed earlier, except for any children, who had been put in a school in a corner of the palace, where they were learning to worship the Goddess Daniel from copies Daniel had made of herself for that purpose. Not all children would be put through her re-education process, as Daniel wanted to have a mix of willing and unwilling servants at all times, but for now she had many of the latter and none of the former. She had not, however, brought back those such as the old and the infirm (unless they had children in her school), as they had no place in her universe--in her. Those with children were put in stasis, to be brought out when their children's education was complete, and to die once told by those children that they were nothing to them, there was only the Goddess Daniel.

Turning her attention to all the other buildings she hadn't destroyed, she again took the children and placed them in her school. The grief of the parents was exquisite, and Daniel looked forward to their greater grief upon their seeing their children in years to come, unable to remember their own parents, only knowing that their Goddess was right to have done what she did.

As for the adults, Daniel first killed anyone unable to perform to her arbitrarily chosen standard, though again, any of those with children were merely placed in stasis. She considered simply making them palace servants like everyone else in the city, but they could provide her with some momentary fun before that. She did note which ones were parents of liberated children: those she would keep alive, or resurrect, in order that their offspring might reject them utterly.
143121221121221.title: L'univers, c'est moi.

143121221122.content:
"I wish to have Superman's powers restored and to have him teleported safely away!"

Melanie's eyes narrowed. "Interfering with my games?" she said, as Daniel hit Superman. He fell backwards at Daniel's blow, but then regained his superpowers, the pain rapidly fading as his invulnerability was restored. But instead of disappearing to safety he remained on the ground, a few feet away from Melanie and Daniel.

Daniel moaned with pleasure and quickly gained her strength and figure back, but when she opened her eyes she was shocked to see Superman still nearby. "You're still here!" she said to Superman. "You lied to me!" she said to Melanie.

"Oh no I didn't. I said you had one wish, and you made two!" Melanie smirked. "So he's got his powers back, but he's still here, still my super-toy to play with, and so are you!"

Superman meanwhile hoped that Melanie was distracted, and lept into the air to fly away. He reached ten feet when his flying power failed him, and he began falling back to earth, landing heavily next to Melanie.

"Sorry, Superman, but thanks to my ring there's nothing that escapes me, not even you!" Melanie sneered as he tried repeatedly to fly away and succeeded only in jumping.

"You said you'd give him back his powers!" Daniel whined. "You don't keep your word in anything!"

"Of course I do. But did I say for how long?" Melanie said and laughed. "Your wish was foolish and incomplete. You could have wished to be more powerful than I am, or to make Superman's powers permanent, but you were too dumb." Daniel looked downcast. "Oh, I LOVE my ring. I always get the last word."

"You're still just a bully! You won't win in the end. You ... can't win!" Daniel said bravely, trying to keep up her spirits.

"Oh yes I will. So long as I have this ring, nothing can stop me. Not you, not Superman, nothing!" she gloated. "And now, Superman, as the price for regaining your superpowers, you will have to use them as I command you. And I command that you use them to discipline Daniel for her rebellious tongue. "

"Never!" he declared. "My powers are pledged to help the people of Earth, not evil bullies like you!"

Melanie snapped her fingers, and her friend Zoe appeared. "Use them as I say, Superman, or Zoe will get your powers, and will use them against you AND Daniel, and she won't be gentle, will you, Zoe?"

Zoe smiled hungrily. "Oh I won't, Mel! I will be vicious, truly vicious!" she said, rubbing her hands. She flexed her modest feminine muscles. "With super-strength, I could do much to them!"

info.brief_description: Someone finds a magic ring that can pretty much do anything.
info.description:
Daniel finds a ring that can give her whatever she wishes.

The ring: holds omnipotent power, can do anything. Users can get the ring to do stuff up to a certain level, depending on various things - their intelligence, their greed, confidence, lust for power, etc. Can be tricked or removed from the holder unless they specificly tell the ring to remain unmmovable.

Characters:

Daniel (18 years old, brunette, 5'3 110 lbs, attractive)
Sharon (15 years old, strawberry blond, 5'1, 104 lbs, cute) Daniels sister.
Melanie (17 years old, black hair, 5'4, 117 lbs, fine looking) a bully, goes to Sharon's school
Jamie (6 years old, blonde, 3'10, 45 lbs) Daniels brother.

Rules:
-NO child pornography of any kind
-Please try to focus more on female characters
-Ring owner swapping is enouraged, however a storyline in which one person holds the ring to be the ever-lasting ruler of the universe is accepted as well.
-Other magical artifacts / crazy inventions with various may exist, but none is superior to the ring.
-Have fun!
